Sentencas: The impact of sulfur-poisoning on reforming chemistry and electrochemistry of anode-supported solid oxide fuel cells is analyzed via electrochemical impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: Different types of anode supported cells are operated in hydrogen/steam - as well as simulated reformate - (H-2+H2O+ CO+CO2+N-2) fuels containing 0.1-15ppm of H2S. A detailed analysis of impedance spectra by the distribution of relaxation times (DRT) and a subsequent complex nonlinear least squares (CLNS) fit separates the impedance changes taking place at the anode and the cathode.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: Two main features were detected in the DRT, a decreased reaction rate of the electrochemical hydrogen oxidation and a deactivation of the catalytic conversion of CO via the water-gas shift reaction.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: During the first exposure of the cell to a H2S-containing fuel, an enhanced degradation is observed.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: The degradation rate increases several hours after H2S was added to the fuel and decreases after the poisoning is completed.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: The polarization resistance increased by a factor of 2-10, depending on H2S-content, fuel composition and cell type.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation

Sentencas: Comparing the temporal characteristics of the polarization resistance of two different anode supported cells, it could be shown that the accumulated H2S-amount divided by the Ni-surface area inside the anode substrate and anode functional layer determine the onset of the degradation.
Titulo: Sulfur Poisoning of Anode-Supported SOFCs under Reformate Operation
